name: Cons: the building block
intro: As we have established earlier, a pair of values is just a special type of function.
From there, arbitrarily complex data structures - list, trees, hash tables, anything - can be built.
So a pair here is represented by the Vireo combinator: V a b f = f a b.
V a b K = K a b = a and V a b (KI) = KI a b = Ib = b allow extracting
the first and second elements of the pair, respectively.
However, in many cases manipulating both values simultaneously into a desired shape
is more convenient than extracting them.
Let's build some functions that manipulate pairs.

content.title: Pair map
descr: Build a combinator that takes a function f and a pair (V a b),
and returns a pair (V (f a) (f b)).

content.title: Quantum Starling
descr: Build a function that takes two functions, f and g,
and a pair (V a b), and produces f a (g b).

content.title: Pair transform
descr: Build a combinator that takes two functions, f and g,
and a pair (V a b) and returns a pair (V (f a b) (g a b)).
cases: phi f g (V a b) x
